data.author: Stephen Darlington
data.description: A watch face for those who dont need the exact time. So here we have a watch face that tells the time in words to the nearest five minute period (so you get 'five past', 'ten past' etc etc). Also shows battery level, bluetooth connection status and current day and date.
data.title: AboutTime - Agency

data.description:
Simple digital watch face using the Orbitron font.

Configurable screen display, choice of languages.  Includes a battery status indicator 
, Bluetooth status indicator and lost connection warning.

The date can be toggled between UK and US format.  
Language selection Danish, Dutch, English, French, German, Italian, Norwegian, Russian, Spanish and Swedish.

data.description:
A simple digital watch face using the Orbitron font.  Includes the day of the week and date. and optional display of seconds.

The display can be inverted and can vibrate in 5 minutes intervals up to an hour.

The date can be toggled between UK and US format.  Language selection English, German, Italian, Spanish, French, Swedish, Danish and Dutch.
Has a configurable battery status indicator.

latest_release.release_notes: fixed time display when in seconds display mode

data.description:
June 12: New settings page.  Option for bigger time.  Updated a few images.


Battery level is shown across the top in 10% increments, and when BT is lost the building windows and sky disappear and the watch vibrates. 

Supports 12/24hr modes. New graphics show for each weather condition. You can adjust the temp size or remove it completely.

The (default) buildings are just a simple drawing - it's not any specific city. The original version can be downloaded from my website. 

With the latest version I've added 25 world city skylines to choose from.  The city picture is NOT linked to weather or GPS.
data.title: City Temp

data.author: Mobile to Go

changelog.release_notes:
* emery support; optimized diorite support
* better obscured support
* changed google altert to www.faroo.com news search because google service is down
* daily step/ estimated distance support
* unbelievable but again a lot of bugfixes

* diorite support
* prepared emery support
* obscured area support
* pebble V4.0 adpations
* a lot of bugfixes/ improvements

* new settings layer
* new license model
* pebble calc supported
* a lot of bugfixes, optimizations

* CW fix
* optimized InfoPanel architecture
* a lot of minor bugfixes/ optimizations

* fully new architecture
* russian support
* "pebble busy" bugfix
* settings dialog optimizations
* small improvements

* fixed appmessage returns error first occurred in V3.6 of SDK
* some minor optimizations

* fixed property issues
* added tap handler
* a couple of optimizations
new twitch property; bugfixes of V5.0; differentiated basalt, aplite config dialogs; some optimizations

We spend energy and a lot of time to optimize something that was near to be excellent. So we are proud to present a new generation of InfoWatch that…

* ... runs on (the old) pebble as well as the new pebble time.
* ... supports (only on pebble time) up to 10 color look and feels!
* ... has in addition a much better gesture recognition algorithm. In particular a new y-axis twitch was added to change "fixed" panels. This enables you to increase news texts, stock lists or to have a glance to the sunrise info etc., event through per default another FixedPanel is configured in the settings.
* ... provides in the settings now a choice of up to 40+ preconfigured feeds.
* ... supports (only on pebble time) up to 24 feed entries in up to 3 configured feeds.
* ... has a new Romanian language resource file.
* ... caches weather, and stock data etc. twice the time you configured your reload time.
* ... (hopefully) fixes the still remaining seldom crashes.
* ... has a lot of (layout) improvements. 

… steps to V5.0 - so have fun!

Bugfix-Release
* fixed app crashes caused by buffer overrun in in_received_handler
* fixed accelerator gets lost
* layout fixes
Features
* messaging IDs, Tuples are generated into appmessages.h

* modified english/ turkish translations
* added new lib
* some improvements

This release fixes a lot of minor bugs - in particular it fixes the bug that a minus sign of a negative temperature wasn't shown. Maybe the summer in Germany wasn't as bad because it didn't get noticed until now. :)
done full review; fixed small issues

New features:

* New currency portfolio configuration feasibility.
* A couple of new RSS/ ATOM feeds are selectable in the settings.

Optimizations:

* A better designed settings dialog in regard to weather location, feeds and stock/ currency portfolio value selection(s).
* More text of a feed entry is provided - in particular if a "news feed fixed layer" is selected.
* Some look and feel optimizations based on my own GUI lib.
* A lot of small bugfixes.

Known problem:

* Some special chars are not shown in the feeds. For example the words with accent and the spanish letter "ñ", doesn't show correctly. I use the pebble system fonts to show news texts. Due to this you have to use pebblebits to generate a system font set also covering your local chars.
* Sometimes the settings dialog will not open and instead an endlessly animated gif cycle is shown. This is a pebble app "bug"/ problem. A simple solution is to retry after you opened another setting dialog. Sorry I've no influence on this and can't fix anything. In case you know how please tell me. :)

New features:

Selected configuration settings are now persistent. Means in case InfoWatch or SlideDeck has to restart the look and feel of the app didn't get lost.
Selected data gathered from the internet is cached. Means in case InfoWatch or SlideDeck has to restart weather information, stock remains available (for a reload period) and mustn't be reloaded (from the internet). Let's name it a fast load operation. ;)
Optimizations:

Finalization and use of a new own pebble (GUI) lib was the main topic of this release. Nearly all functionality is now provided by a lib. Two positive consequences: Stability, memory reduction and the opportunity for rapid new app development. ;)

Known problem:

Some special chars are not shown in the news InfoPanel. For example the words with accent and the spanish letter "ñ", doesn't show correctly. I use the pebble system font "FONT_KEY_GOTHIC_14" to show news texts in the normal InfoPanel. Due to this you have to use pebblebits to generate a system font set also covering your local chars.
Sometimes the settings dialog will not open and instead an endless animated gif cycle is shown. This is a pebble app "bug"/ problem. A simple solution is to retry after you opened another setting dialog. Sorry I've no influence and can't fix anything. In case you know how please tell me. :)

New Features:

* Implemented a more generic RSS/ ATOM feed parser. A couple of feeds throwing an error in older InfoWatch versions will work now. 
* Up to 3 days of forecast. A new setting determines if either 1, 2 or 3 days are displayed in the forecast InfoPanel. One day of forecast looks nice,, three days give more information. It's up to you what you want to see. ;)
* New Setting to start week on Sunday instead of Monday.

Optimizations:

* A lot of code cleanups, further reduction of memory consumption and first usage of a new GUI lib.
* Optimized build process and usage of code generation feasibilities.
* Compiled with the new SDK 2.5
* A couple of layout optimizations.
* A lot of code fixes and optimizations.

Known problem:

* Some special chars are not shown in the news InfoPanel. For example the words with accent and the spanish letter "ñ", doesn't show correctly. I use the pebble system font "FONT_KEY_GOTHIC_14" to show news texts in the normal InfoPanel. Due to this you have to use pebblebits to generate a system font set also covering your local chars.
* Sometimes the settings dialog will not open and instead an endless animated gif cycle is shown. This is a pebble app "bug"/ problem. A simple solution is to retry after you opened another setting dialog. Sorry I've no influence and can't fix anything. In case you know how please tell me. :)
fixed iphone settings not shown bug

New Features:

* Configurable GPS interface in the settings to set hight accuracy, timeout and location cache age properties.
Up to 3 public holiday names are shown.
* The expression "KW" (for calendar week) is now more international. :) In case you have better translations send it to me!

Optimizations:

* Fully reimplemented the load data algorithm and redesigned some pebble to phone exchange data structures.
* Outsourced further string tokens into resource files - due to this no further memory is necessary in case new translations were added. In case your translation is still missing/ or incorrect, provide the translation to me - (for a small donation) I will add/ correct it.
* Again further memory improvements to get more free space for new functionality - we remain below the 24kb barrier. ;)
* A few layout improvements.

Bugfixes:

* Hopefully I fixed now the "Fix weather forecast got lost" bug.
* Now further special chars will be handled which are not part of the iPhone charset.
* A lot of small fixes not worth to get mentioned in detail. Be happy that they are now gone. ;)

Known problem:

* Some special chars are not shown in the news InfoPanel. For example the words with accent and the spanish letter "ñ", doesn't show correctly. I use the pebble system font "FONT_KEY_GOTHIC_14" to show news texts in the normal InfoPanel. Due to this you have to use pebblebits to generate a system font set also covering your local chars.
* Sometimes the settings dialog will not open and instead an endless animated gif cycle is shown. This is a pebble app "bug"/ problem. A simple solution is to retry after you opened another setting dialog. Sorry I've no influence and can't fix anything. In case you know how please tell me. :)

data.description:
A smart watchface with a lot of information gathered from internet or pebble health.

It provides a notification service, rather additive the time, day, a calendar and date (in nearly any language), the bluetooth connection as well as the battery state is shown on top of a Fixed Panel e.g. 

* 2 fix stock/currency values,
* the state of the sun
* a news ticker
* the upcoming weather forecast
* a small calendar or
* the step count/ estimated distance. 

Below dynamic InfoPanels are switched in 60 sec delay or by two diffenerent kinds of accelerator control. Shown are

* the current weather, 
* the forecast graphs of your current location/ a fixed location, 
* (further) stock/currency values,
* up to 3 news feeds/ google alerts,
* a big calendar with public holidays or
* the step count/ estimated distance illustarted by a funny picture.
data.title: InfoWatch

data.description:
Another try at a big number watch, this time with numbers loosely based on a stencil font.  Only updates once a minute to maximize battery life.

Custom settings include screen colors, date format, Bluetooth connectivity, battery usage, and vibrations.
data.title: Bigger Watch

data.author: hikoLab
data.description:
WorldNow is a RSS news watchface with smooth animation.

This watchface acquires headlines of news through RSS and display them. If you tap on or shake the watch, the characters of the headlines begin to move and form the digits of time. (In the case of the sample screenshot, time is 13:48.)

This work expresses the relation between the current time and events taking place in the world now.
data.title: World Now

data.author: Yang Bo

changelog.release_notes: Enhanced battery status display when charging
enhanced battery display; enlarged status bar UI elements

data.description:
Features: time, bt/battery status, settings

Design:

Life is full of up-and-down's with lying-down horizontal lines representing hour one to six and straight-up vertical lines seven to twelve. 

Free and seemingly random, a tiny floating rectangule circles around the puzzle signalling every past minute, while seconds accumulate and penetrate deep trying to solve it.

What is your answer?
data.title: Puzzle of Lines

data.author: henrik
data.description:
This watchface shows the time hour+minute. There is a transition effect every minute. 
Seconds are represented by the two circles in the upper left and lower right corner. It has a battery indicator in the upper right corner and a bluetooth indicator in the lower left corner.   A tap event temporarily shows the date.
data.title: Flying Numbers

data.author: henrik
data.description:
A watchface with Japanese kanji showing the
time (hour+minute). 
Seconds are represented by the leafs of the two flowers. Within a minute the flowers are loosing all leafs.
It has a battery indicator in the upper right corner and a bluetooth indicator in the lower left corner.



A  tap event temporarily shows the date.
data.title: Japanese Kanji Watchface II

data.author: Jim Cavera

changelog.release_notes: This initial release supports all major features, except for floating-holiday support.  Those will be implemented in the next release.

data.description:
Want to live your life as a surrealist?  An extension of one of my previous Burning Man projects, this "clock" updates at irregular intervals, and with thousands of possible messages, it will give you time that is even fuzzier.  And will on occasion, let you know if zombies are about, or what epoch it is.

Always accurate, but seldom useful!  Or always useful, but seldom accurate.  Whichever.

latest_release.release_notes: This initial release supports all major features, except for floating-holiday support.  Those will be implemented in the next release.

data.author: Leav
data.description:
=It's a WATCHFACE, not an APP=
An easy-to-use watchface which acts just like a simple stopwatch.

It helps me a lot when making tea. I hope it can also be helpful to you!
Unstoppable version available.

Usage:
- To start, just switch to this watchface
- To pause / resume, shake it left or right.
- To reset, switch to any other watchface, and then switch back again

data.author: thedadams

changelog.release_notes: Fixed a bug that kept the date from updating if the watch was plugged in.
Changed the way single-digit days are displayed - I "minimized" it.
Added inverted color and minute hand options. Also a few, very nice, design tweaks.
Finally just capped the battery at 90%.
Finally made the battery work like I wanted.
Officially dropped "Weather" from the name.  Fixed a stupid battery bug.

This is a major upgrade adding the following features: * The hand now has the ability to show the Pebble battery charge percent via a "decreasing bar" visual. * The hand has the ability to flash while charging. * The watch can vibrate on the hour. All of these features can be turned on or off by the user via configuration.
Finally fixed the spacing issue for the month and day.
Fix for the month not showing properly.
Watch now emits long vibration when it disconnects from bluetooth and two short vibrations when it connects to bluetooth.

data.description: Minimal watchface displays the time, month, day, and day of the week.  The "hand" points in the direction of the hour and the large number in the center gives the minutes past the hour.  For example, the 1st screen shot reads "4:10".  There are several ways to customize the watchface including battery level in the hand, hourly vibes, and switching the number in the middle from minutes to the hour.
data.title: Minimal

data.author: William Heaton
data.description: A month view calendar that checks the calendars on your Android device and displays days which have an event in bold. Extremely Customizable.
data.title: Calendar Watchface

Indonesian Fuzzy Text

2 APR 2014
UPDATED! Yeay! Corrected most of the bugs.
Still a little bit more debugging to do. Thanks for trying it out! And please send me any comments or suggestions! Thanks!

28 Mar 2014:
My first try.. Sorry it is still a little bit messed up.. Will update it soon! Thanks for trying it out. Let me know if you have any comments. :D

data.author: Chris Lewis
data.description:
The Potential Divider watchface, but with a larger font.

For space reasons, the output voltage is now limited to one digit.

data.author: Chris Lewis
data.description:
Shows a potential divider circuit with hours, minutes as R1 and R2, day of the month as input voltage, and real simulated output voltage.

An animated 'electron' moves around to show seconds.
data.title: Potential Divider: Small

data.author: Labcats
data.description:
A vertical, -fully- binary watch (also based on "Just a Bit").  Because it's vertical, there's no wasted space and the circles are nice and bright.

Also, in 12 hour time, the hour shrinks down to four binary digits, and there's an am/pm bit above the third column.

The colums are, left to right: month, day, Hour (in 12 hour mode, AM/PM), minute, second

[no source today; I'll upload source in an
data.title: BitStack

data.description:
Show your Miami Heat Spirit by using the Miami Heat Watchface!

Includes:
- Bluetooth Connection Icon
- Battery Percentage
- Day and Date

Let's Go Heat!

latest_release.release_notes: Use abbreviated Month so date does not cut off on certain days/months.

data.author: chops
data.description:
TrekV3 is also available - search the pebble appstore for 'TrekV3' or by my dev name.

TrekV2 DOES NOT require 'health'


Star Trek (LCARS) style.

Settings page has many languages, various date formats, weather config, monday or sunday startdate.

You can also make the date in the lower right corner look like a stardate by selecting 'day of year', in the watchface date settings, or invert the entire face.  

The watch vibrates when bluetooth is lost. 12/24hr modes supported.
data.title: TrekV2

data.author: Jnm

changelog.release_notes: Fixed small digits colors for B&W Pebbles
Fixed battery percentage display when inverted (white background)
Move battery status at the bottom of the screen

data.description:
Eventually in Color!!
Huge digits that do not fit in the screen! Versions Available : date/nodate, day/month, month/day, and week day in Danish, Dutch, English, French, German, Italien, Spanish or Swedish, minutes in small or big digits, all configurable from within the Pebble Phone App !

10 oct - updated settings - style choice, bg color, icons on/off

A simple watchface, with the time numbers appearing grey - just lots of tiny dots. Supports 12/24hr.

data.author: Martin Norland (@cynorg)

changelog.release_notes: Bugfixes: Weather and seconds are behaving properly again! (and various sundry related improvements).  Compiled with 3.6 SDK.
Bugfix for monday start of week (array out of bounds exception was occurring)

BUGFIXES:
 - Temperature supports 3 digits
 - date_format fixes (fixed missing comma after format #234, and updates settings to v12)
(published with reverted javascript, same as 2.3.4)
- compiled with 2.4.1 SDK
* Fixed localized date format(s), no JS changes ( does not include Yahoo Weather, reverted JS... )

data.description: Watch shows date and the time on the top, and a calendar with 3 (configurable) weeks days on the bottom, and weather next time. A statusbar at the top provides the connection, charging/hourly vibration indicator, and battery status. Preferences (style, vibration, date format, text localization, and optional display items) are configurable via the Settings/Configure option within the Pebble app.

latest_release.release_notes: Bugfixes: Weather and seconds are behaving properly again! (and various sundry related improvements).  Compiled with 3.6 SDK.

data.title: Timely

data.author: Paolo Perkovic
data.description:
bFit is an activity & sleep tracker watchface for the Pebble Smartwatch. It can track your daily activities like steps, distance traveled, active minutes and even track your sleep with insights on your time in deep and light sleep phases.

NOTE: Please consult the settings (bFit description) page for usage instruction

Tracking modes:
ACT - tracking activity throughout the day
SLP - sleep tracking
data.title: bFit

data.author: Oliver Bowe

changelog.release_notes: minor tweak hide leading zero of the hours so  1 instead of 00

data.description:
Experimental version of the Big Bariol watchface, which detects which way up the watch is and flips the face accordingly.  
Ideal if you wear your pebble on the left hand. Or if you want to show someone the time.

latest_release.release_notes: minor tweak hide leading zero of the hours so  1 instead of 00

data.author: chops
data.description:
A simple watchface with a thinner font displaying both am/pm and 24hr timesimultaneously, with seconds.  An easy reference for those in the medical profession (nurses for example) to quickly see time in both formats.

You can also make the time background black or white. Battery status and BT across the middle, times displayed swap for 12/24 hr modes. 

Battery status is also shown by the thin line dividing the time formats. 

If you swap time formats on your watch they also change respective positions.
data.title: Thinner DualTime

data.author: acymbalski

changelog.release_notes: -am/pm indicator now works correctly (thanks for the feedback!)

data.description:
A cleaner, more readable version of the original Progressor app.

Displays date, month, time, weekday, and year as a progress bar that updates once a minute.

New as of 1.1.1:
-am/pm indicator now works correctly

New as of 1.1.0:
-Time font is larger and has been realigned
-Code cleaned up (for my own sake)
-"am/pm" indicator at the bottom-right of the time bar

latest_release.release_notes: -am/pm indicator now works correctly (thanks for the feedback!)

data.title: Progresssor 2

data.author: FLAG Solutions

changelog.release_notes: First published version. Includes a current mode indicator to make your life easier :-)

data.description:
Octal Watch, shows hours, minutes and seconds in octal representation. It's a must have for every geek :-)  

Just shake your writst to show the human readable time (but only to prove yourself not being a real geek!)  

Enjoy this geeky Pebble watchface by FLAG Solutions

data.description:
Dots Watchface

Features
- Analog watchface with filled dots for hour and minute display
- Option for a seconds indicator
- Digital time display (24h/12h format)
- Date display (German / English)
- Battery Status Icon (Battery charging, Battery charged full, Battery below defined charge setting)
- Bluetooth disconnected warning (Icon and vibration)

- accelerometer usage improvements

data.description: Simple watchface with big time symbols. Time, date, weekday. To enter a setup mode shake your watch. During 3 seconds current option will be displayed (sec on/off, font size, ...). If you want to apply new option value just switch to any other watchface or press menu button. When you'll switch back, new option value will be applied

Hex Watch, shows hours, minutes and seconds in hexadecimal representation. It's a must have for every geek :-)

Just shake your writst to show the human readable time (but only to prove yourself not being a real geek!)

Enjoy this geeky Pebble watchface by FLAG Solutions

data.author: Interface

changelog.release_notes:
TO DO:
Display the battery level

data.description:
A stylized watch face which display hours, minutes and seconds with a graphic code of 12 bars :
4 bars for hour, 4 for minutes and 4 for seconds.
How to read the time :
Bar 1 - top : first 0 to 11 hours, bottom : 12 to 23 hours
Bar 2 - top : first 6 hours, bottom : second 6 hours
Bar 3 - top : first 3 hours, bottom : second 3 hours
Bar 4 - 0, 1 or 2 hours more
I'll let you figure the rest !

latest_release.release_notes:
TO DO:
Display the battery level

data.title: Timecode

data.author: SetPebble

changelog.release_notes: 4.9 Phone-based pins with manual location fix
4.3  Patch for new Pebble Time Android
3.1  Pebble Time Round support; new timeline icon

data.description:
The next high and low tides of the closest monitoring station are displayed (USA & Canada only).  Current weather conditions for temperature, wind, pressure, humidity, and clouds are displayed.

The temperature scale, wind scale, background, and other items are customizable.  Flick or tap to change the status between last time updated, tide station name, current weather description, and sunrise/sunset.

The tide station can be manually entered, and the weather source selectable from OpenWeatherMap, Yahoo Weather, NOAA, and (for premium subscribers) Forecast.io.

For Pebble Time, Fair Tides supports timeline pins with low and high tides.

latest_release.release_notes: 4.9 Phone-based pins with manual location fix

data.title: Fair Tides

changelog.release_notes: tweaked the design a little and switch to orbitron font

data.description:
A mash up of simplicity and Very Plain. 

The top half is a smaller version of VeryPlain and the bottom half is similar to Simplicity which also includes a day of week indicator.

Configurable language English, French, German, Italian, Spanish, Swedish, Danish and Dutch, vibration in 5 minute intervals to hourly.

latest_release.release_notes: tweaked the design a little and switch to orbitron font

Big Time but with the Bariol font and configurable.

Can also vibrate at configurable intervals.  

kudos to Albert Rojo (@albertrojo) based on the Big Time watch by Pebble Technologies.

Using the type Bariol Light (http://www.bariol.com) for this smartwatch.

Most of the programming credits go to Pebble Technologies. I did some mods on the resource files, and upgraded it to V2.0 SDK

data.author: Jose Castellanos
data.description:
This watchface besides showing you the time, it tells your phone status. Your battery level for your phone, the power source the phone is using while charging, the ringer mode  and the type of internet connection you have whether it is WiFi or 3G.
It also vibrates when your internet connection changes and the battery of your phone is full or down.
Needs companion app available only for Android!

data.description: RhinoDevel's DETONATOR stops the watchface boredom now! Shows second hand as heavily animated, pulsating and constantly increasing/decreasing ring plus some other graphical gimmicks. Let me warn you - this watchface attracts a lot of attention. :-) Also displays day of week and month, battery info & bluetooth state. Detonator vibrates, if connection is lost. Enjoy and don't explode! ;-)

ios.name: Lupo Phone Tracker and Device Finder

data.description:
Lupo Pebble App allows you to monitor your Android and iDevices.

Never lose your phone or tablet again. Get a vibration alert on your wrist when your phone goes out of range from your Pebble (up to 50 meters). 

-- Shake your wrist to Find your phone anytime.

Note:  You will be able to use the Pebble App with Lupo Device Finder App version 2.7 and above in the App Store.

data.author: Number3
data.description: An analog watch, zoomed very close to the hour hand. So close, in fact, that you can read the time down to the exact minute using only one hand. This version includes labels on the hours and half-hours, so it's easy to read.
data.title: Zoomed (with numbers)

data.author: Jake Lin
data.description:
Get the Australian Weather info (temperature, feels like temperature and conditions) from Bureau of Meteorology (BoM) at one glance. And keeps the weather info updated very 15 minutes. 

Love the app, check out our iPhone App as well. Besides current temperature info, it has forecasts and live radar images. http://bit.ly/australianweather

Based on the work by Niknam Moslehi (Futura Weather).
data.title: Australian Weather

data.author: Eric Oesterle

changelog.release_notes:
• Added color menu icon for Pebble Time
• Fixed issue where text on bottom left & right was partially cut off due to rounded corners on Pebble Time. (Thanks, Baron S.!)
Fixed issue where the ‘M’ in AM (or PM) is cut-off on the right side when showing the time like 10:40 AM. Thanks to Baron S. for reporting this!

• Added colorful Hawaiian images for Pebble Time!
• Added battery level

data.description: A text watch inspired by many trips to Maui, and my love of languages. Local time is spelled out in the Hawaiian language. Background images change on the minute, and are from selected nature photos shot on Maui. Feel free to send feedback on suggestions and grammatical improvements. Based on the Fuzzy Time example from the Pebble SDK.

latest_release.release_notes:
• Added color menu icon for Pebble Time
• Fixed issue where text on bottom left & right was partially cut off due to rounded corners on Pebble Time. (Thanks, Baron S.!)

data.title: Hawaiian Time

data.author: Bogdan Ripa
data.description:
This watchface shows the time as you would read it in Romanian.

Example: patru fara douazeci si cinci
data.title: Time in Romanian

data.author: Noah Greenberg
data.description:
Stylish, simple, yet complex.

Grab the time, date, weather, and location right from your watch while still maintaining a good look.

Configurable!
- Color inverting
- 24 Hour Time
- Temperature Scale (F/C/K)

The time font is "Coda": http://www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/coda
data.title: Vida

data.author: sciolle
data.description:
The activiTime watchface captures and displays the amount of physical activity during the past 7 days.

Just let the watchface run to see a detailed plot of your activity build up as time goes by.
The bottom graph presents today's activity in 10 minutes intervals. The top graph is a summary of the previous 6 days in hourly intervals.

No companion apps required.
data.title: activiTime

data.author: ilker Aktuna
data.description:
English text watchface with Star Wars lightsaber duel at every hour.
X-wing animation at a shake of your wrist.

Please donate if you like my watchface using below address:
http://aktuna.us/pebble/donate.html

Donators will gain right to make requests about the watchface.

data.author: Shay Kalyan

changelog.release_notes: Updated configuration URL after host backend change.
Fixed bug where Wednesday would get cut from screen. Font size reduced.

data.description:
A minimalist watch face for the Pebble smart watch.

The outer ring displays minutes and the inner ring indicates hours. At five minute intervals, the tracing block animates 1/12th of the way along the edge to update the time.

The animated preview shows the time transitioning from 6:55 to 7:00. 

Configuration:
- Flick view styles (wrist-flick for more info!)
- Invert
- 5-min vibrate

latest_release.release_notes: Updated configuration URL after host backend change.

data.author: hikoLab
data.description:
In order to grasp a lapse of time at a glance, elements are displayed in progress bar style.

If a watch is worn on the left wrist, the left side of the display is hidden beneath the cuff. So in this watchface, the elements of time which we often want to know are arranged on the right side of the LCD.

1.1.0: Support 12-hour style.
